wiki.content: "Video Killed the Radio Star" is a song by the British synthpop/new wave group Buggles, released in 1979. It celebrates the golden days of radio, describing a singer whose career is cut short by television. The song topped several music charts and has been covered by many recording artists. It was the first music video shown on MTV in North America at 12:01 am on August 1, 1981 and has been widely parodied in popular media. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Video Killed the Radio Star" is a song by the British synthpop/new wave group Buggles, released in 1979. It celebrates the golden days of radio, describing a singer whose career is cut short by television. The song topped several music charts and has been covered by many recording artists. It was the first music video shown on MTV in North America at 12:01 am on August 1, 1981 and has been widely parodied in popular media.

track.name: Video Killed the Radio Star
comments: Pretty amazing detail I learned from a Trevor Horn interview @ Red Bull Music Academy: there are no sequencers used on this track, everything was played live!

"Video Killed the Radio Star" was, indeed, the first video played on MTV... However, the video that presently runs at the top of this web page is NOT that video!  This one only shows the band members standing around singing it.  The original MTV video began with a young girl listening to an old radio -- then she's transported to a laboratory with Trevor Horn (wearing a white lab coat) and a woman in glittering tights who come flying out of a plastic tube.  All mesmerizing stuff telling a story--like so many great MTV videos--not just showing the band playing.  Sadly, that classic original video is hard to come by now.
Yes, Eye_Gore, the first! Followed by "You Better Run" by Pat Benatar. August. 1, 1981. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/First_music_videos_aired_on_MTV
Check me if I'm wrong, but wasn't this the very first video ever played on MTV ?
pictures came and broke your heart.
Probably the best " novelty song " I have heard, slipped into my mind set from day one, and remains, superb pop
cool little ditty back in the 80s!!!
The scene in 'Take This Waltz' with this song playing is hypnotic
I want my MTV back !!!!!! I watched MTV on day one. Now it is nothing but garbage and no music.
